t: Isaiah 60
The Gentiles Bless Zion
Arise,*pn shine; For*ld your light has come! And*ld the glory of the Lord*s is risen upon you.
For*ld behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, And*ld deep darkness the people; But*ld the Lord*s will arise over you, And*ld His glory will be seen upon you.
The*ld Gentiles shall come to your light, And*ld kings to the brightness of your rising.
“Lift*ln up your eyes all around, and see: They*ld all gather together, they come to you; Your*ld sons shall come from afar, And*ld your daughters shall be nursed at your*i side.
Then*ld you shall see and become radiant, And*ld your heart shall swell with joy; Because*ld the abundance of the sea shall be turned to you, The*ld wealth of the Gentiles shall come to you.

The*ld multitude of camels shall cover your land,*i The*ld dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; All*ld those from Sheba shall come; They*ld shall bring gold and incense, And*ld they shall proclaim the praises of the Lord.*s

All*ld the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together to you, The*ld rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you; They*ld shall ascend with acceptance on My altar, And*ld I will glorify the house of My glory.
“Who*ln are*i these who*i fly like a cloud, And*ld like doves to their roosts?

Surely*ld the coastlands shall wait for Me; And*ld the ships of Tarshish will*i come*i first, To*ld bring your sons from afar, Their*ld silver and their gold with them, To*ld the name of the Lord*s your God, And*ld to the Holy One of Israel, Because*ld He has glorified you.
“The*ln sons of foreigners shall build up your walls, And*ld their kings shall minister to you; For*ld in My wrath I struck you, But*ld in My favor I have had mercy on you.
Therefore*ld your gates shall be open continually; They*ld shall not be shut day or night, That*ld men*i may bring to you the wealth of the Gentiles, And*ld their kings in procession.
For*ld the nation and kingdom which will not serve you shall perish, And*ld those*i nations shall be utterly ruined.
“The*ln glory of Lebanon shall come to you, The*ld cypress, the pine, and the box tree together, To*ld beautify the place of My sanctuary; And*ld I will make the place of My feet glorious.

Also*ld the sons of those who afflicted you Shall*ld come bowing to you, And*ld all those who despised you shall fall prostrate at the soles of your feet; And*ld they shall call you The City of the Lord,*s Zion*ld of the Holy One of Israel.
“Whereas*ln you have been forsaken and hated, So*ld that no one went through you,*i I*ld will make you an eternal excellence, A*ld joy of many generations.
You*ld shall drink the milk of the Gentiles, And*ld milk the breast of kings; You*ld shall know that I, the Lord,*s am*i your Savior And*ld your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

“Instead*ln of bronze I will bring gold, Instead*ld of iron I will bring silver, Instead*ld of wood, bronze, And*ld instead of stones, iron. I*ld will also make your officers peace, And*ld your magistrates righteousness.
Violence*ld shall no longer be heard in your land, Neither*ld wasting nor destruction within your borders; But*ld you shall call your walls Salvation, And*ld your gates Praise.
God the Glory of His People
“The*pn sun shall no longer be your light by day, Nor*ld for brightness shall the moon give light to you; But*ld the Lord*s will be to you an everlasting light, And*ld your God your glory.
Your*ld sun shall no longer go down, Nor*ld shall your moon withdraw itself; For*ld the Lord*s will be your everlasting light, And*ld the days of your mourning shall be ended.
Also*ld your people shall*i all be*i righteous; They*ld shall inherit the land forever, The*ld branch of My planting, The*ld work of My hands, That*ld I may be glorified.
A*ld little one shall become a thousand, And*ld a small one a strong nation. I,*ld the Lord,*s will hasten it in its time.”
